snippet: Missouri is a swing state where even the name changes, and disagreement among residents over the pronunciation goes back more than a hundred years.
abstract: Candidates campaigning in Missouri must carefully decide between two common pronunciations of the key swing state's name; choice serves as a case study in the age-old art of political pandering.

byline.contributor: Dan Gill contributed reporting from Sedalia, Mo.

lead_paragraph: Missouri is a swing state where even the name changes, and disagreement among residents over the pronunciation goes back more than a hundred years.

headline.seo: Missouree? Missouruh? To Be Politic In Missouri, Say Both
headline.main: Missouree? Missouruh? To Be Politic, Say Both
headline.print_headline: Missouree? Missouruh? To Be Politic, Say Both
